beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads input (trade ids) from a file * converts input into a map * uses an enrichment processor to get more data from a db and use it to enrich the input data * converts the resulting ordereddmap to xml * writes to stdout
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of a database based enrichment processor.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config enrich-processor.xml
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar lib/opt/hsqldb.jar
This example relies on a hypersonic database running (http://www.hsqldb.org) to run up the server make sure hsqldb.jar is in your class path and run the following...
java org.hsqldb.Server -database.0 hsql -dbname.0 xdb
The command needs to be executed from a folder containing Hypersonic script and properties (hsql.script and hsql.properties) located in example/spring/connectors/db
Once the adaptor is running you should see several records echo-ed in XML:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="ISO-8859-1"?> <record><TradeId>1</TradeId><QUANTITY>1000000</QUANTITY><PRICE>3.25</PRICE><BUYSELL>B</BUYSELL></record> ...

property.name: sql
property.value: SELECT BuySell, Qty as Quantity, Price FROM TRADE WHERE TradeId = ?
